result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman S Barksdale

ADDRESS INFO for Norman S Barksdale
Current: 6700 W. Appleton, Milwaukee, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 11-01-2022)
Prior: Milwaukee County House of Correction, 8885 S. 68th Street, Franklin, WI 53132 United States
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee House of Corrections.

11:02 AM Defendant Norman S Barksdale, in custody, appeared by video.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Norman S Barksdale.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has a plea and sentencing scheduled in his Milwaukee matter in November.
Defense requests plea and sentencing after that date.
Court quashes capias.
Court orders cash bail in the amount of $50.00.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Make all future court appearances.  No new law violations.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
